greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 + A053827(n-1), where A053827 is the sum-of-digits function in base 6.
comment: If A053827 is regarded as a triangle then the rows converge to this sequence, i.e., a(n) = A053827(6^k+n-1) in the limit k->infinity, where k plays the role of a row index in A053827.
See conjecture in the entry A000120.
This sequence is the base b=6 case equivalent to A063787 (b=2), A173523 (b=3), A173524 (b=4), A173525 (b=5). Generic comments concerning the various bases are in A173525.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = A053827(6^k+n-1) where k >= ceiling(log_6(n/5)). - _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 09 2010
Conjecture: Fixed point of the morphism 1->{1,2,3,...,b}, 2->{2,3,4,...,b+1},
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 20 2010
